contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox settlement |official_name = East Fork, Arizona |settlement_type = [[Census-designated place|CDP]] |image_skyline = |imagesize = |image_caption = |image_seal = |image_map = Navajo_County_Incorporated_and_Unincorporated_areas_East_Fork_highlighted.svg |mapsize = 250px |map_caption = Location in [[Navajo County]] and the state of [[Arizona]] |image_map1 = |mapsize1 = |map_caption1 = |subdivision_type = [[Countries of the World|Country]] |subdivision_type1 = [[US state|State]] |subdivision_type2 = [[List of counties in Arizona|County]] |subdivision_name = [[United States]] |subdivision_name1 = [[Arizona]] |subdivision_name2 = [[Navajo County, Arizona|Navajo]] |government_type = |leader_title = |leader_name = |established_date = |area_magnitude = |area_total_km2 = 7.5 |area_total_sq_mi = 2.9 |area_land_km2 = 7.5 |area_land_sq_mi = 2.9 |area_water_km2 = 0.0 |area_water_sq_mi = 0.0 |elevation_ft = 5240 |elevation_m = 1597 |population_as_of = 2000 |population_footnotes = |population_total = 880 |population_metro = |population_density_km2 = 118.1 |population_density_sq_mi = 305.9 |timezone = [[Mountain Standard Time Zone|MST]] |utc_offset = -7 |coordinates_display = inline,title |coordinates_type = region:US_type:city |latd = 33 |latm = 48 |lats = 1 |latNS = N |longd = 109 |longm = 55 |longs = 43 |longEW = W |timezone_DST = |utc_offset_DST = |postal_code_type = |postal_code = |area_code = |blank_name = [[Federal Information Processing Standard|FIPS code]] |blank_info = 04-21310 |blank1_name = [[Geographic Names Information System|GNIS]] feature ID |blank1_info = 0025319 |footnotes = |website = }} '''East Fork''' ({{lang-apw|'''Hawúʼishįįhé'''}}) is a [[census-designated place]] (CDP) in [[Navajo County, Arizona|Navajo County]], [[Arizona]], [[United States]]. The population was 880 at the [[2000 United States Census|2000 census]]. ==Geography== East Fork is located at {{coord|33|48|1|N|109|55|43|W|type:city}} (33.800242, -109.928566).{{GR|1}} According to the [[United States Census Bureau]], the CDP has a total area of {{convert|2.9|sqmi|km2}}, all of it land. ==Demographics== As of the [[census]]{{GR|2}} of 2000, there were 880 people, 209 households, and 169 families residing in the CDP. The [[population density]] was 305.9 people per square mile (118.0/km²). There were 228 housing units at an average density of 79.3/sq mi (30.6/km²). The racial makeup of the CDP was 99.55% [[Race (United States Census)|Native American]], 0.45% [[Race (United States Census)|White]], and no [[Race (United States Census)|Black]]/[[Race (United States Census)|African American]], [[Race (United States Census)|Asian]], [[Race (United States Census)|Pacific Islander]], [[Race (United States Census)|other races]], or two or more races. 0.68% of the population were [[Race (United States Census)|Hispanic]] or [[Race (United States Census)|Latino]] of any race. There were 209 households out of which 41.1% had children under the age of 18 living with them, 41.6% were [[Marriage|married couples]] living together, 29.7% had a female householder with no husband present, and 19.1% were non-families. 16.3% of all households were made up of individuals and 1.4% had someone living alone who was 65 years of age or older. The average household size was 4.21 and the average family size was 4.64. In the CDP the population was spread out with 40.7% under the age of 18, 10.7% from 18 to 24, 26.4% from 25 to 44, 17.6% from 45 to 64, and 4.7% who were 65 years of age or older. The median age was 24 years. For every 100 females there were 96.9 males. For every 100 females age 18 and over, there were 100.8 males. The median income for a household in the CDP was $15,208, and the median income for a family was $20,000. Males had a median income of $14,125 versus $16,034 for females. The [[per capita income]] for the CDP was $4,772. About 44.0% of families and 53.9% of the population were below the [[poverty line]], including 57.1% of those under age 18 and 72.5% of those age 65 or over. ==Education== East Fork is served by the [[Whiteriver Unified School District]]. ==See also== * [[Fort Apache Indian Reservation]] ==References== <references /> {{Navajo County, Arizona}} [[Category:Census-designated places in Navajo County, Arizona]] [[Category:Populated places in Arizona with Native American majority populations]]
